availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Russell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William "Billie" Dunbar and Elizabeth "Betsy" Nelson Dunbar. Married to Nancy Ellen Dunbar. Father of Frances E. Dunbar, William Dunbar, John Dunbar, and James Dunbar. Resident of Russell County in 1850. Farmer in Russell County in 1860. Farmer in Russell County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District 2, p. 255A-255B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Russell, p. 73B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, Wolf Creek, p. 186A.

Find A Grave, "Jasper Dunbar (1838-1930)," Memorial #61780244, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/61780244 (accessed July 6, 2020).
